dc_title_s: Siege of Delhi. : Plan of the British position maintained from 8th June to 14th Sept. 1857.
dc_description_s: Cartographic Details: Scale 1:6,000. 500 ft. - 1 in. (E 77°11ʹ35ʺ--E 77°14ʹ12ʺ/N 28°43ʹ10ʺ--N 28°39ʹ18ʺ). Relief shown as contours. Shows: roads, canals, position of British troops. Text and illustrated insets: Delhi Munity Monument -- Miniature embrasure built to mark the position of the batteries -- Siege battery memorials -- Cashmere Gate Memorial. "Drawn in the Quarter Master General's Office, Simla, June 1876." 64 x 99 cm
dc_creator_sm: India. Army. Simla Army. Quartermaster-General's Office.
